thread.title: Apple green lights electric car project
thread.title_full: Apple green lights electric car project

title: Apple green lights electric car project
text:
Apple green lights electric car project Vehicles could be available by 2019 Published On: Sep 22 2015 09:47:54 AM CDT Tweet NEW YORK - 
Apple is giving the green light to its production of an electric car. The Wall Street Journal reports the vehicle will be available in 2019. Related Content Tim Cook talks charity, coming out as gay on 'Late Show' By Jose Pagliery and Frank Pallotta 
Nasdaq.com reports that more information about the project should be coming out soon including when the tech giant will be testing the vehicles on roads. 
Apple has been hiring managers from automobile companies as of late. Autonews.com reported the hire of a senior engineer from Tesla Motors Inc. last month. 
Fox News reports that although Apple has talked about using a self-driving car testing facility, the company’s first car will likely not be driverless. 
Apple will be hiring more people to add to its car project’s team of 600 people, according to Fox News.
